00060 void Preprocessor::optimalThreshold (const double &threshold)
00061 {
00062     if ( threshold < 0.0 )
00063         optimalThreshold_ = 0.0;
00064     else
00065     {
00066         if ( threshold > 1.0 )
00067             optimalThreshold_ = 1.0;
00068         else
00069             optimalThreshold_ = threshold;
00070     }
00071 };

00092 void Preprocessor::backgroundReferenceGrayLevel (const double &grayLevel)
00093 {
00094     if ( grayLevel < 0.0 )
00095         backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ = 0.0;
00096     else
00097     {
00098         if ( grayLevel > 1.0 )
00099             backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ = 1.0;
00100         else
00101             backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ = grayLevel;
00102     }
00103 };

00162 void Preprocessor::convertToGrayscale (Clip &clip)
00163 {
00164     if ( clip.colorspace() not_eq COLORSPACE_GRAYSCALE )
00165         clip.colorspace(COLORSPACE_GRAYSCALE);
00166 };

00179 double Preprocessor::computeOptimalThreshold (Clip &clip)

00182     convertToGrayscale(clip);

00185     
00186     return 0.0;

00203 double Preprocessor::findBackgroundReferenceGrayLevel (Clip &clip, const unsigned int &referenceGrayLevelNeighbours)
00204 {
00205     // Implicit change of colorspace
00206     convertToGrayscale(clip);
00207     
00208     
00209     // Compute image histogram
00210     vector<unsigned int> histogram(256, 0);
00211     
00212     for (unsigned int i=0; i < clip.height(); ++i)
00213     {
00214         for (unsigned int j=0; j < clip.width(); ++j)
00215         {
00216             // Get gray level of this pixel
00217             double grayLevel = clip.getPixel(i,j).grayLevel();
00218             
00219             // Update histogram
00220             histogram[floor(grayLevel * 255.0)] += 1;
00221         }
00222     }
00223     
00224     
00225     // Search the more frequent level of gray
00226     vector<unsigned int>::iterator histogramIterator;
00227     unsigned int moreFrequentGrayLevel = 0, levelCounter = 0;
00228     
00229     for (histogramIterator = histogram.begin(); histogramIterator not_eq histogram.end(); ++histogramIterator, ++levelCounter)
00230     {
00231         if ( *histogramIterator > histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel] )
00232             moreFrequentGrayLevel = levelCounter;
00233     }
00234     backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ = moreFrequentGrayLevel * histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel];
00235     
00236     
00237     // Search the neighbours of the more frequent level of gray
00238     vector<unsigned int>::reverse_iterator histogramReverseIterator( find (histogram.rbegin(), histogram.rend(), histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel])++ );
00239     histogramIterator = histogramReverseIterator.base()++;
00240     double nFrequencies = histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel];
00241     
00242     for ( unsigned int i = 1; i <= referenceGrayLevelNeighbours; ++i )
00243     {
00244         // Search forwards
00245         if ( histogramIterator not_eq histogram.end() )
00246         {
00247             backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ += (moreFrequentGrayLevel + i) * histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel + i];
00248             ++histogramIterator;
00249             nFrequencies += histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel + i];
00250         }
00251         
00252         // Search backwards
00253         if ( histogramReverseIterator not_eq histogram.rend() )
00254         {
00255             backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ += (moreFrequentGrayLevel - i) * histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel - i];
00256             ++histogramReverseIterator;
00257             nFrequencies += histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel - i];
00258         }
00259     }
00260     
00261     
00262     // Set the background reference gray level found
00263     backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ = (backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ / nFrequencies) / 255.0;
00264     return backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_;
00265 };

00283 void Preprocessor::removeIsolatedNoise (Clip &clip, const unsigned int &isolationCoefficient)
00284 {
00285     // Implicit change of colorspace
00286     convertToGrayscale(clip);
00287 
00288     
00289     // Find background reference gray level
00290     findBackgroundReferenceGrayLevel(clip);
00291     
00292     
00293     // Loop over the clip to remove every noisy isolated pixel
00294     for (unsigned int i=0; i < clip.height(); ++i)
00295     {
00296         for (unsigned int j=0; j < clip.width(); ++j)
00297         {
00298             unsigned int nBackgroundPixels = 0, nPixels = 0;
00299             Pixel neighbourPixel;
00300 
00301             // Explore the pixel neighbourhood
00302             for(int p = i-1; p < (signed int)i+2; p++)
00303             {
00304                 for(int q = j-1; q < (signed int)j+2; q++)
00305                 {
00306                     // Check clip borders
00307                     if ( (p < 0) or (p >= (signed int)clip.height()) )
00308                         continue;
00309                     
00310                     if ( (q < 0) or (q >= (signed int)clip.width()) )
00311                         continue;
00312                     
00313                     nPixels++;
00314                     
00315                     // Get neighbour pixel gray level
00316                     neighbourPixel = clip.getPixel(p, q);
00317                     
00318                     // When background gray level is close to white but not the pixel, update the noisy neighbours counter
00319                     if ( (backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ > optimalThreshold_) and (neighbourPixel.grayLevel() > optimalThreshold_) )
00320                         nBackgroundPixels++;
00321                     else
00322                     {
00323                         // When background gray level is close to black but not the pixel, update the noisy neighbours counter
00324                         if ( (backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ < optimalThreshold_) and (neighbourPixel.grayLevel() < optimalThreshold_) )
00325                             nBackgroundPixels++;
00326                     }
00327                 }
00328             }
00329             
00330             // Adjust the isolated coefficient influence according to the number of neighbours found
00331             unsigned int realIsolationCoefficient = nPixels - 8 + (8 - isolationCoefficient);
00332 
00333             // Delete the noisy pixel if it is isolated
00334             if (nBackgroundPixels >= realIsolationCoefficient)
00335                 clip.setPixel(i, j, backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_);
00336         }
00337     }
00338 };
